responses: Hello. I am Xian Liang. I studied chemistry in NTU and I code for fun. I like skill-based challenges and strive to be a better person every day.

patterns: what can you provide for our company
responses: Years of training as a chemist has equipped me with strong analytical skills. I am proficient in various lab techniques including NMR and IR. I have done a summer internship with Professor Patrick Martin in his marine chemistry lab in 2021 involving the electrocatalysis of nitrates in seawater into nitrites. We used UV-vis techniques to determine the concentration of nitrite in the seawater. I have learnt a lot about troubleshooting issues in the lab from that. I am also proficient in Python and Javascript. From my coding skills I have also built a website for the NTU Aquatic Biochronology Lab. Also, you can have a look at my personal projects from my portfolio site at https://xchu002.github.io/portfolio/

I am self-driven and have the urge to improve myself to benefit the community. I gain satisfaction from learning and applying my skills for the benefit of others. For example, aside from studying chemistry, I have been learning to code in my free time. I have also been active in the rotaract club and the NTU Buddhist society to help out the community.

I have trouble focusing sometimes. I overcome this by being upfront about my weakness and asking more questions if I miss something that someone else has said. I take more precautions in my daily life such as using the google calendar for every little thing and setting alarms.

patterns: what kind of work environment do you prefer
responses: Personal growth is important to me. I like environments where I can solve problems and develop my skills. I also thrive in teams where people are supporting each other instead of competing.

patterns: do you work well under pressure
responses: I've found that a healthy amount of stress motivates me to stay on track and work as efficiently and effectively as possible. For example, deadlines are important to me. If my manager doesn't give me deadlines, I set them for myself. That's how I'm able to consistently turn in assignments on time.

patterns: Do you prefer working independently or on a team?
responses: I enjoy a blend of the two. I like having a team to strategize with, get diverse opinions from, and reach out to for feedback. But I am also comfortable taking on assignments that require me to work independently. I find I do some of my best work when I can focus alone in a quiet space, but I really value collaborating with my teammates to come up with the best ideas.
